text:
Camped here for two nights. BEAUTIFUL views as you can see from the pictures attached. Nice campsites with a covered shelter and picnic table at each site. A couple things to note though.
1. There is only one bathroom. It is at the south end of the campground and looks like it hasn't been updated in 30+ years. The shower stalls do not have shower curtains or rods.
2. There is a VERY busy highway 100-200 feet away from all of the campsites. A lot of LOUD diesel trucks ROAR by here at all hours of day and night. So BRING EARPLUGS if you would like to be able to sleep at night! Especially if you are tent camping! I forgot mine the first night and slept horribly. The 2nd night I had bought some and they blocked out all the noise and I slept much better.
3. Each covered shelter has a light socket. It may or may not have a light bulb already in it. So bring your own and you won't have to use a lantern. There are circuit breakers for each site that control the electricity.
4. There are a lot of biting ant hills around the campground. We took rocks from the fire ring and placed one by each ant hill in and around our campsite so we would be able to see be aware of them day and night.
5. The non-preferred campsites are just as nice and have just as great of views as the preferred campsites. So save yourself $5.
prediction_reason: The review provides a detailed and genuine camping experience at Lake Lawtonka, describing specific aspects like facilities, location challenges, and practical tips. The content is highly relevant to a recreation center/camping location, and the 3-star rating aligns with the mixed positive and negative feedback provided.

text:
This Mazzios needs to clean house on their staff. Its deplorable!! I have been trying to buy pepperolies for a week and they are always out (at 5:30 or 6 in the evening). We came in at 6 and there were 2 other couples in there eating so they weren't busy. It took us forever to find a clean table and when the girl working there did finally come out and clean up I watched her wipe off 7 tables with the same rag and no cleaning solution!! Disgusting!! I have worked in restaurants and this is not acceptable. This should have been a clue when we pulled up to the restaurant the door to the kitchen was open to the outside and they were all standing around talking. The bathrooms were horrible as well. There was a bunch of hair in the sink of the ladies room and it looked like it hadn't been cleaned in months. The mens bathroom had no SOAP AND THE COOKS WERE MEN.
When we tried to place our order for the pepperolies and found out they were out again she never offered to tell us what the specials were to help us out. She was just a warm  body standing behind the counter. My husband ordered a salad and everything was low or out, the crackers were smashed and unusable. We ordered a thin crust pepperoni and it looked like a flatbread pizza, didnt know they had that. The cheese dippers were too brown and not tasty.
As we were leaving another couple came in and looked at the buffet and salad bar and left. Wish we wouldn't have wasted our money!
This is too bad because we love Mazzios but we wont be back to this one (and it's in our town)until they get better management.
